result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary D Runge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -IF Revoked: Sentence credit of 2 days is granted.

miscConds.notes: -Restitution for Meijer to be joint/several with Co-Defendant.

-Standard court costs waived. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling.

-Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
-No contact with the Co-Defendant and the Meijer store listed in the criminal complaint.
-Make best efforts to maintain/obtain full time employment, schooling, or a combination of the two. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary D Runge

defendant.name: Runge, Zachary D
defendant.address: 2389 W Rawson Ave, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zachary D Runge in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Zachary D Runge. Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed on the document.  State and Atty. Kershek confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Kershek.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld sentence (Court will award 2 Days Credit IF defendant is revoked and sentenced)

Term of Probation: 12 Months

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with the Co-Defendant and the Meijer store listed in the Criminal Complaint.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Make best efforts to Maintain/Obtain full time employment, schooling, or a combination of the two.

RESTITUTION: $1,424.50 to be paid to Meijer to be Joint/Several with the Co-Defendant.

COSTS:  Waived by the Court.

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by Atty. Kershek requesting to have the 9/1/2022 Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled.  **Reviewed by Judge Melvin, on behalf of Branch 7, 8/31/22 - Request granted.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

08:52 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Zachary D Runge in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kersheck provides an update, he is requesting plea and sentencing date in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:38 AM Defendant Zachary D Runge in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests another status date.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with co-actor/Mejier listed in the Criminal Complaint.    Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:55 AM Defendant Zachary D Runge in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $150.00 per month commencing April 15, 2022.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
